content: Make sure you’ve added the meta tag in the `<head>` part of your website’s code, just before the `</head>` tag. If your website has caching, try clearing it and then refresh the page. Also, check that your website is public and not locked behind a login. If you're using a website builder like WordPress or Wix, double-check that you’re adding the tag in the SEO or custom code section.

creator: bats059

content:
Have you specified that directory in Thunderbird?

Are mbox files inside the sbd folders? They should be named "Inbox", "My People", and "Other Stuff" without extensions.

I do not know why Thunderbird sometimes does not recognize mbox files in a profile.

If I had only three mbox files to deal with, I would:

  1. Close Thunderbird.
  2. Back up those mbox files.
  3. Move those mbox files from the "Local Folders" directory to a temporary location such as the desktop.
  4. Empty the "Local Folders" directory in my profile.
  5. Open Thunderbird.
  6. Install the ImportExporTools NG add-on.
  7. Make sure that the local folders account exists in Thunderbird.
  8. Use ImportExportTools NG to import each mbox file into the local folders account.

Other people may know more and have other/better ideas.
creator: mozilla98

content: I've just tried going offline, to force a download of all mail, but alas it didn't work.
creator: mrstaemin7

content:
The question is whether it is a valid mbox file. Thunderbird didn't create it and therefore has no ownership of it. I suggest - exiting thunderbird - copy the file to the Mail\Local Folders folder - restart thunderbird

The above steps are basically the same as using the importexporttools addon. If these steps don't work, then there is a reason thunderbird is rejecting it.

content:
Per poter inquadrare il problema prova a fornire queste informazioni:

  1. Versione di Thunderbird
  2. Versione del sistema operativo
  3. Provider delle caselle email (Gmail, Libero, Hotmail, etc.)
  4. Tipologia di account (POP3, IMAP)
  5. Estensioni installate
  6. Messaggi di errore che vengono visualizzati durante l'utilizzo di Thunderbird
  7. Software di sicurezza eventualmente presenti (Antivirus e simili)
  8. Screenshot del problema (se utile a chiarire il contesto)

creator: mozilla98

content:
re :I noticed that a large part of one of my local folders is missing.

I presume by local folders you are talking about the 'Local Folders' special account. So if different you need to clarify.

Please post/upload an image of the 'Folder Pane' which shows everything in 'Local Folders' account.

Then post/upload images that show what is in the profile folder: Assuming you are using Windows OS

  • In search type: %Appdata%
  • select the %Appdata% file folder
  • Select 'Roaming' folder
  • Select 'Thunderbird' folder
  • Select 'Profiles' folder
  • Select name of profile folder
  • Select 'Mail' folder
  • Select 'Local Folders' folder

Make sure the view is showing all contents in column details format, extensions and hidden files must be allowed. Make window large enough to show all contents - or if necessary post more than one image.

This means I can compare profile with Folder Pane and check to see if appropriate files are missing.

What Anti-Virus do you use ? Is it allowed to scan your Thunderbird profile folders ? Do you use any Anti-Virus or other cleanup program like CCleaner or Wisecleaner that cleans up temp files etc? If yes, then what do you use?
creator: Toad-Hall

content:
Hi Douglas:

First, what Toad-Hall said :-)

Second, have you tried Thunderbird Troubleshoot Mode? If it works in TB Troubleshoot mode, it's probably a 3rd party issue like an add-on issue. If it doesn't work in Troubleshoot Mode then it may be a Thunderbird bug.

Cheers! ...Roland

content: Do you also have a "Sent" folder? If you do and this is a Microsoft account, Microsoft will put sent messages automatically in the "Sent Items" folder. You do not want any option checked for saving sent messages in account settings > copies & folders. If you check anything, duplicates will be saved.

content: You need to allow cookies in Thunderbird for the OAuth authentication to work. Make sure you don't use a VPN while authenticating. Also, don't run any software blocking TCP port 80 on your computer, e.g. like a local web server.

content: Thunderbird does not have a repository to save emails, other than the email folders associated with the accounts. Thunderbird acts only as an agent for email accounts. You might check with your email provider to see if they retain backups of user accounts.
